intro: Pleuradenia scabra, commonly known as the rough pleuradenia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its rough, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the daisy family. Pleuradenia scabra is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
